The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#8994](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/8994.html) (Testchains: Introduce custom chain whose cons
Concept ACK, will review in next few days.

Concept ACK, but I find the test hard to read atm.  I'm confused about what's actually in `blockheader_testnet3.hex`. Are those the headers without the block hash of the real testnet3 chain?  Because I don't see the checkpoint hash in there. Also, rather than having two lines with `fork:` and a parser to deal with that, maybe just hard code those in the test itself? Alternatively, create a seperat

Added an inline comment to hopefully explain it better, @Sjors 

> Are those the headers without the block hash of the real testnet3 chain? Because I don't see the checkpoint hash in there.

Serialized headers include only the hash of the previous block, so if the last header is the checkpoint, the block hash of the checkpoint will never appear in the data file.
> With and without checkpoints enabled I would expect this fork to be accepted if it's the first thing we see.\n\nAdded test case (and node 1). Also, fixed up your comment suggestions.
Thanks for adding the node 1 example. Code review ACK 333317c
Nit: "Disable checkpoints and feed low work fork headers again (succeeds)"
Nit: "Feed headers of fork with less PoW (fails due to checkpoint)"
Nit: "Feed non-fork headers, up to and including the first checkpoint (succeeds)"
